title: LLMs in Mobile Apps: Practices, Challenges, and Opportunities
author: Kimberly Hau (University of Toronto), Safwat Hassan (University of Toronto), Shurui Zhou (University of Toronto), ...
relevance_why: The insights on integrating Large Language Models (LLMs) into mobile applications could inform methodologies for enhancing audio-related applications through intelligent features.
background: Integrating Large Language Models (LLMs) like ChatGPT into mobile applications to provide advanced functionalities such as chat and content generation.
contribution: This study presents a dataset of 149 LLM-enabled Android apps and explores their integration strategies and developer practices.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous studies primarily focused on AI integration in general software but lacked specific insights into mobile apps using LLMs.
technical_comparison.novelty: This paper provides a detailed analysis unique to mobile environments, addressing specific constraints and strategies not previously discussed.

key_innovation: The approach to classify and analyze various integration strategies for LLMs across mobile applications is distinctive, highlighting both challenges and practical solutions.
real_world_impact: This research can guide developers in creating more effective LLM-enabled mobile applications, enhancing user experience in areas such as productivity and interactivity.
limitations: No explicit limitations were mentioned by the authors.
open_sourcing: The dataset is publicly available in a replication package on GitHub.
